p: As the main factors affecting the quality of the essential oils obtained from essential oils-bearing plants, plant chemotype, growing conditions and location, fertilizers used, time of harvesting and post-harvest treatment (including preservation method) are mentioned [ 2, 11]. Among those factors, the preservation method has the most significant influence, where the most common one for plants rich in essential oils is drying [ 16, 17, 18]. Drying of essential oil-bearing plants allows one to obtain sustainable products with guaranteed quality, although it may cause also considerable losses of valuable constituentsâ€”mainly affecting the volatile constituents [ 17]. Furthermore, the color of the raw material may be strongly influenced by drying [ 16].
